RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Fifth Circuit: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States District Court for the Sou: United States District Court for the Southern District of Texas
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Immigration Services: United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS)
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Immigration authorities: United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS)

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court where Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa's case was heard and pleaded guilty, presided over by United States Magistrate Judge and United States District Judge, made aware of Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa's family situation and membership in a gang, established 'fast track' programs, imposes sentences
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the defendant attempted to re-enter and was previously deported from
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Bureau of Prisons: custody provider for Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa's imprisonment, responsible for holding Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa in custody
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexico: country to which the defendant was previously deported and claims citizenship
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Department of Homeland Security: handled application for derivative citizenship, oversees immigration services
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Attorney General: official who authorized early disposition programs, including 'fast track' programs
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Commission: issuer of the Guidelines Manual, consulted in determining sentence, issued Amendment 740 and Amendment 742, recognized variations in criminal history seriousness
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Judge: judge before whom the defendant pleads guilty and decides on sentencing, calculated the criminal history and sentenced Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Magistrate Judge: judge who recommends acceptance of guilty plea, prepared the Report and Recommendation, made a finding regarding Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa's understanding of the charges and his rights
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Guidelines: guidelines used for calculating criminal history points and applying applicable guidelines, consulted in determining sentence, includes amendments such as Amendment 740 for cultural assimilation and Amendment 742 for elimination of recency points
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa: defendant who filed objections in support of a motion for downward departure, has a history of violating immigration laws, sentenced to 90 months of imprisonment, alleges counsel was ineffective for failing to recognize amendments to the United States Sentencing Guidelines and for not investigating claim of United States citizenship, waived right to appeal sentence and conviction
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Probation Office: office that prepared the PSR report documenting the defendant's statement and background
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: appellate court that gives great weight to defendant's statements at the plea colloquy, affords great weight to the defendant's statements at the plea colloquy, and has cautioned against subjecting attorneys to unrealistic standards when reviewing motions, held that a court may consider a defendant's cultural assimilation, interprets the United States Sentencing Guidelines
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Department of Justice: department whose attorney is authorized to offer 'fast track' programs
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court for the Sou: court where 'fast track' programs were initially implemented near the Rio Grande
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Congress: legislative body that intended sentencing disparity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE: agency conducting interview with Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rio Grande: river crossed by the defendant to enter the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo: city in Texas where the defendant's family resides and where he re-entered the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: state in the United States where the defendant re-entered and has family ties
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Citizenship and Immigratio: part of the Department of Homeland Security that handled the application for derivative citizenship, denied Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa's application due to insufficient proof of paternal presence in the United States
